intro: Urachne stipoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf urachne, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Urachne stipoides is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
